bioghist.p: Isaac Snowden, Jr. (1763-1835?), was a Philadelphia merchant and a dedicated churchman. He was treasurer of the Board of Trustees of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church in the United States of America (PCUSA) from 1799 until his death and of the Presbytery of Philadelphia. Snowden was also an active member and officer of the Second Presbyterian Church of Philadelphia, serving as secretary of its Board of Trustees from 1802, as its pew agent, and on the Congregational School Committee. In 1818 he was ordained an elder. He also served as secretary or treasurer of some of the voluntary societies of Philadelphia, including the Evangelical Society, the Missionary Society, the Humane Society, and the Magdalen Society.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains daybooks with Snowden's observations on his daily activities, mostly listening to sermons and his notes and responses to them. Many of the sermons were given by Dr. Janeway and Dr. Green. The daybooks include some reporting on business and organizational affairs of the Church. Snowden writes regularly, though not daily. There is one volume consisting of quotations and reflections from his reading.
